wikipedia_page.main: George Gray was a British hurdler. He competed in the men's 110 metres hurdles at the 1920 Summer Olympics.

response: * George Gray (Australian politician) (1903–1967), member of the Australian House of Representatives
* George Gray (Tasmanian politician) (1899–1984), member of both houses of the Tasmanian Parliament
* George Gray (Pennsylvania politician) (1725–1800), speaker of the Pennsylvania Provincial Assembly
* George Gray (senator) (1840–1925), U.S. Senator from Delaware
* George Gray (television personality) (born 1967), currently the announcer for The Price Is Right and former host of The Weakest Link
* One Man Gang (born 1960), American professional wrestler born George Gray
* George Gray (footballer, born 1894) (1894–1972), English football wing half active in the 1920s, later trainer of Sunderland
* George Gray (footballer, born 1925) (1925–1995), English football wing half active in the 1950s, son of the above
* George Gray, founder of the Hawkhurst Gang, a notorious smuggling organisation in southeast England from 1735 until 1749
* Sir George Gray, 3rd Baronet (c. 1710–1773), officer of the British Army
